text:
Since xmlsec 1.4.RC2a classes that are derived from KeyResolverSpi should have a
default constructor because of some code in KeyResolverSpi:
KeyResolverSpi tmp = (KeyResolverSpi) getClass().newInstance();

The thing is that I don't want that the class KeyResolverSpi instantiates
itself. Since my derived key resolver was passed arguments during construction
via the constructor, a new instance would not have these arguments passed in.
This makes 1.4.RC2a unusable for my application.
creator: info@frankcornelis.be

text:
Even some classes of xmlsec itself (under
org/apache/xml/security/keys/keyresolver/implementations) will fail on this I guess.
creator: info@frankcornelis.be

text:
How do you register your new implementation the only way doing this is in
public static void register(String className);
And there is no public constractor for KeyResolver!!!
And the only protected constructor takes a string argument!!!
creator: raul-info@r-bg.com
raul-info@r-bg.com
text:
I see how you manage, you are right, if you use
KeyInfo.registerInternalKeyResolver(KeyResolverSpi realKeyResolver), you can
register an already created keyresolverSpi.
I will fix this, tonight. 

As work arround you can overload
public PublicKey engineLookupAndResolvePublicKey
in your KeyResolverSpi  it will fix your problem, make your class works in 1.3 &
1.4 and make it a little faster in 1.4.

Anyway I will fix it tonight and send you a new jar.

Regards,

creator: raul-info@r-bg.com
text:
Fixed in SVN head & 1.4RC3.
Thanks for noticing can you test it again.

Regards,
